hackathon-description-text: This 24-hour collaborative hackathon is the perfect opportunity for students, developers and aspiring entrepreneurs to showcase their talents and share valuable insights.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Academic Director/Ed Kaplan Family Institute for Innovation and Entrepreneurship

hackathon-eligibility: We believe technology should be built by people with different backgrounds and perspectives. All are welcome and we’d love to have a diverse, comfortable creative environment for everyone! Any attendees under the age of 18 will need written permission from a parent or guardian to attend.
hackathon-requirements: The judges will award the first place prize to the team that builds the best application of blockchain technology. All submissions must be posted on Devpost.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=965 W Chicago Ave, Chicago, IL 60642, USA
hackathon-location-address: 965 W Chicago Ave, Chicago, IL 60642, USA
hackathon-description-header: Build solutions that utilize the advancements of blockchain technology in finance-related, real-world applications.
